definition[0]: if a group or an organization holds together, or if something holds it together, it stays strong and does not separate into different parts or groups
example[0]: Against all expectations, the coalition held together well.
example[1]: In those days the church held the community together.
definition[1]: to remain whole and good enough to use, or to make something do this
example[2]: Incredibly, the raft held together till we reached the opposite shore.
example[3]: I wondered how the structure was held together.
